str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fellow elder. From sun and presbuteros; a co-presbyter.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.
A sharer, partner, companion. From koinos; a sharer, i.e. Associate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
